subject: Art & Design
title: Vivienne Westwood: Punk's Fashion Godmother
description: A fast breakdown of Vivienne Westwood: Punk's Fashion Godmother for builders.

hook.text: Vivienne Westwood dressed the Sex Pistols. Safety pins, ripped shirts, and bondage straps became punk's uniform.

buildup.text: From her London shop SEX (later Seditionaries), Westwood turned anti-fashion rebellion into an actual fashion movement.

discovery.text: Punk fashion was political: DIY aesthetics, destruction of luxury codes, and visible anger against the establishment.

twist.text: Westwood later became a respected haute couture designer. The rebel joined the establishment she once attacked.

climax.text: She spent her final decades as a fierce climate activist, using fashion shows to protest environmental destruction.

punchline.text: Westwood proved that fashion can be a weapon. She never stopped fighting.

quiz.question: How did Vivienne Westwood connect punk culture to fashion?
options: She dressed the Sex Pistols and turned DIY rebellion into a fashion movement
She organized the first punk music festival
She wrote the punk manifesto that inspired musicians
